data.what_is:
Born in 1997 and headquartered in the UK, RedEye is an AI driven marketing automation provider that uses data, technology and people to empower UK based B2C brands to drive strategies that attract, engage, convert and retain customers.

We're proud of our track record of generating significant ROI for our clients by providing them a sophisticated solution which enables them to better understand and respond to their customers. 

Our platform draws data from multiple sources, consolidates and enables you to gain richer insights about your customers & their behaviour, allowing you to build customer relationships through multi-channel personalisation, maximise opportunities within the customer lifecycle and increase Customer Lifetime Value.
data.product_description: Our Marketing Automation tool, driven by an advanced SCV database, helps you to deliver market leading resultsWe have the tech, the team and the determination to uncover intelligence in your customer data to empower you to drive game-changing multi-channel marketing strategies.Through our strong data capabilities we'll help reduce the headaches of dealing with varied data sources so you can get the most out of your customer data.Our advanced technology enables you to reduce your tech stack by providing you all the tools you need to gather insight, build campaigns and grow the sophistication of your marketing strategies.Finally data and technology cannot existing without people. With a solid 20+ years experience our dedicated teams are on hand to become a reliable extension of your marketing team and help you develop a growth strategy right for your business. Because of this personalised approach on average our clients see an increase in 38% in marketing automation revenue in just the first year.

pricing_plans.plan_description:
Perfect for businesses who use ecommerce platforms such as Shopify and want a simple plug and play package to drive their marketing automation.
 
Moving to RedEye will give you greater access to even more of your customer data to use in powerful segmentation and detailed personalisation.
 
This package is ideal for those marketers who don't require any ongoing support right now and want to take their multi-channel automation to the next level, managing all their own campaign creation and delivery.
plan_features: Database size - Scalable 'pay as you grow' pricing that increases at a reasonable rate in line with your database growth.
Marketing channels - On top of email, you can access all channels but only pay when you need to use SMS, Push and Direct Mail. We're adding more channels all the time!
Integrations - A variety of common integrations such as Shopify, Dealerweb, Trustpilot and LoylatyLion are all available as standard, only pay for specific custom integrations.
AI predictive models - Whatever your business challenge, we have a predictive model that can help and can easily be added to your package.
Consultative support - Pick and choose how much support you require and we'll help you create a unique marketing automation strategy.
Managed Services - Our talented team of email coders and designers are on hand to help you with any additional campaign creation support you may need to get your campaigns live.

pricing_plans.plan_description:
This package is ideal for those businesses who use an ecommerce platform such as Shopify and have marketing teams who would like a level of expertise and platform support to drive their marketing further.

You'll also get our powerful Reporting and Insights suite, surfacing business insights via natural language querying.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: As reported in 10 RedEye reviews. Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically This feature was mentioned in 35 RedEye reviews.

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending. This feature was mentioned in 35 RedEye reviews.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Based on 36 RedEye reviews. Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Based on 27 RedEye reviews. Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information. 18 reviewers of RedEye have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Based on 29 RedEye reviews. Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Based on 28 RedEye reviews. Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: As reported in 32 RedEye reviews. Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: As reported in 16 RedEye reviews. A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: As reported in 19 RedEye reviews. Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information. 31 reviewers of RedEye have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization. This feature was mentioned in 16 RedEye reviews.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps. This feature was mentioned in 17 RedEye reviews.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Based on 21 RedEye reviews. Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: As reported in 14 RedEye reviews. Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: As reported in 14 RedEye reviews. Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI. 20 reviewers of RedEye have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar. 10 reviewers of RedEye have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR. This feature was mentioned in 10 RedEye reviews.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time This feature was mentioned in 11 RedEye reviews.

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: Based on 35 RedEye reviews. Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity. This feature was mentioned in 19 RedEye reviews.

features.name: ROI Analytics
features.content: Based on 18 RedEye reviews. Measure leads, prospects generated, pipeline, revenue, investment, and ROI by marketing channel or program. The result is that you can see which marketing investments are generating the greatest return and get visibility into how marketing budget should be allocated going forward.

features.name: Revenue Analytics
features.content: As reported in 18 RedEye reviews. Analyze how leads flow through the funnel by measuring stage to stage conversion rates and velocity.  Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: Data Enrichment
features.content: Based on 12 RedEye reviews. Uses external data sources to improve customer profiles.

features.name: Expandability
features.content: Can be updated to accept new sources and types of data. 11 reviewers of RedEye have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Content Marketing
features.content: Based on 11 RedEye reviews. Can act as a content marketing platform.

features.name: Multiple Devices
features.content: Can engage with customers across any device with a consistent message. This feature was mentioned in 14 RedEye reviews.

features.name: Marketing Metrics
features.content: Based on 15 RedEye reviews. Provides analysis of marketing program ROI and efficiency.

features.name: Predictive Modeling
features.content: As reported in 13 RedEye reviews. Predicts outcomes based on statistical models; can give insight to "what-if" scenarios.

features.name: Recommendation Engine
features.content: Uses artificial intelligence to provide suggestions based on desired outcomes. 11 reviewers of RedEye have provided feedback on this feature.

initial_reviews.review_title: Redeye is easy to use and efficient
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
Redeye is fairly simple to use once you get used to its wide range of options and tools available and can handle a large load of data, which is perfect for many businesses like JD, as they're massive companies with a large number of customers whose data needs to be looked at to improve the company, along with many employees specialised in different fields. This is where many of the different tools available in redeye can be used by different people for different uses, especially things like automation for marketing

What do you dislike about RedEye?
Redeye may be a little bit overwhelming when first starting, as it takes some getting used to, but gets fairly easy once you have some guidance from other people. Redeye could maybe make it a little more user friendly by including some easily accessible tutorials for certain tools/tasks as some things are not explained well.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
Redeye is especially helpful when sending out large amounts of emails to large groups of people, split up by custom segments and using the customer data provided by redeye to better target customers and provide them with a more tailored email experience.

initial_reviews.review_title: Good Software - very reliant on the people at redeye though
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
The system collects lots of valuable data and also emails are the best possible to avoid getting blocked or put in people's junk.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
You cant do a lot yourself. Most projects need redeye to support you and a lot of the features come at an extra cost. The system crashes... a lot. There aren't many features out of the box either, for example, landing pages.

Recommendations to others considering RedEye:
If you are looking to have full control and the ability to function autonomously this isn't for you but if you need that extra support this is a great option.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
we use red-eye to curate and communicate with our customers. One key benefit we have found is the ability to use the APIs to employ personalised content on our website based on the data stored in redeye.

initial_reviews.review_title: A professional service provided by experts in the CRM field
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
We have worked with RedEye for several years throughout the business, the service provided has always been to a high standard and delivered in a professional manner. Compared to other CRM services I personally have found RedEye to be one of the better suppliers.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
It may just be a recent bump but we have found lately that RedEye support have taken a bit longer than normal to get back to us on requests, hopefully this is just a short term thing and RedEye can maintain their timely response as per previous years.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use RedEye for a number of data and CRM solutions, with recent GDPR regulations we have found RedEye to be helpful in regards to compliance on data issues. Usually RedEye are able to manage requests from a large scale business like our own without much trouble.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about RedEye?
review_question_answers.answer: We have worked with RedEye for several years throughout the business, the service provided has always been to a high standard and delivered in a professional manner. Compared to other CRM services I personally have found RedEye to be one of the better suppliers.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about RedEye?
review_question_answers.answer: It may just be a recent bump but we have found lately that RedEye support have taken a bit longer than normal to get back to us on requests, hopefully this is just a short term thing and RedEye can maintain their timely response as per previous years.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We use RedEye for a number of data and CRM solutions, with recent GDPR regulations we have found RedEye to be helpful in regards to compliance on data issues. Usually RedEye are able to manage requests from a large scale business like our own without much trouble.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
Their customer management is excellent. The design team produce some amazing designs. The insights tool to extremely handy.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
The platform overall. It is hard to get into; I have to use a different browser, where I use nothing else. When reviewing more than 30 days of data, even for one or two campaigns, the table at the bottom of the insights tool doesn't show all the data but gives you the total revenue, for example. This means you must download and work through the data rather than seeing it directly on the platform.

initial_reviews.review_title: First class experience from start to finish
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
Friendly staff, great training, user-friendly system, ongoing support

What do you dislike about RedEye?
Mobile preview not accurate when building emails, automatic saving can be a pain when halfway through building content, won't work with my google chrome unless in guest tab for some reason. Minimal moans, all in all great software

Recommendations to others considering RedEye:
For me, it is a no-brainer. The software is incredibly user-friendly and enables a wide range of layouts and features to make your emails stand out. The training from Paul was first class and the best training I have received in my role by far. Paul also split the training over two sessions which enabled me to get to grips with the system and learn myself before moving on to advanced features of the builder. After the 2 sessions, I had a couple of calls with Paul when I had questions about features and ideas I'd like to implement, which he was accomodating with working around my WFH schedule. Lottie and Olivia are also fantastic, I genuinely can't express how great they are at what they do. No question is a chore & their responses are prompt and informative. Every interaction I have had with Redeye has been positive, and I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone. So much so that I am moving companies and have asked what solutions they can offer. If that isn't the best recommendation I don't know what is.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation of emails including abandoned baskets, changing emails to more of an editorial format, adding dynamic content such as videos and countdown timers

This is where many of the different tools available in redeye can be used by different people for different uses, especially things like automation for marketing

What do you dislike about RedEye?

Redeye could maybe make it a little more user friendly by including some easily accessible tutorials for certain tools/tasks as some things are not explained well.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
Redeye is especially helpful when sending out large amounts of emails to large groups of people, split up by custom segments and using the customer data provided by redeye to better target customers and provide them with a more tailored email experience.

all_reviews.review_title: First class experience from start to finish
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
Friendly staff, great training, user-friendly system, ongoing support

What do you dislike about RedEye?
Mobile preview not accurate when building emails, automatic saving can be a pain when halfway through building content, won't work with my google chrome unless in guest tab for some reason. Minimal moans, all in all great software

Recommendations to others considering RedEye:
For me, it is a no-brainer. The software is incredibly user-friendly and enables a wide range of layouts and features to make your emails stand out. The training from Paul was first class and the best training I have received in my role by far. Paul also split the training over two sessions which enabled me to get to grips with the system and learn myself before moving on to advanced features of the builder. After the 2 sessions, I had a couple of calls with Paul when I had questions about features and ideas I'd like to implement, which he was accomodating with working around my WFH schedule. Lottie and Olivia are also fantastic, I genuinely can't express how great they are at what they do. No question is a chore & their responses are prompt and informative. Every interaction I have had with Redeye has been positive, and I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone. So much so that I am moving companies and have asked what solutions they can offer. If that isn't the best recommendation I don't know what is.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation of emails including abandoned baskets, changing emails to more of an editorial format, adding dynamic content such as videos and countdown timers

Multichannel campaign / data management tool all in one place makes it easy to proudce impactful campaigns in close to real time. I enjoy the fact that the team are able to produce marketing campaigns on the fly as opposed to waiting for an analyst to create a selection for them, thus slowing the process down.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
Dynamic content in template builder could use an update so its more intuative, and does not rely on coding in creative manager.

The team at RedEye are more than willing to demonstrate the power of the platform, and did so to us through a lenghtly proof of concept. After competing against some big industry players, RedEye came out on top in our RFP Matrix.
It offers us the best solution to manage our data and marketing campaigns effectively, saving time and money in the process.
The platform gives the user the opportunity to upskill in their role by learning new skills such as segementation, personalisation and more. We now have multiple journey flows that consists of email, direct mail, and social media marketing.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
We merged two platforms in to one, this makes it easier for us to have close to real time data. We are able to empower users to create marketing segments and do not rely heavily on data analysts to do this, thus making it faster for us to leverge our marketing campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Versatile platform with a responsive support team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
The Redeye platform is great for catering to the way you want to work, whether you use the built-in email designer or build your emails externally, whether you want to control every detail of your scheduling or allow the predictive and automated systems to lead your comms. The drag and drop interface for campaign setup is easy to use and features many options in order to create effective customer journeys. The built-in rendering preview is amazing! Reporting on results is extremely extensive, giving both numerical and visual representations of campaign performance. The team are friendly and always available for support and advice, whatever the issue!

What do you dislike about RedEye?
I find that the interface as a whole can be a bit clunky and unintuitive, with multiple paths to the same functions, from opening campaigns to viewing results. Some menu options seem completely redundant, like the 'email' option under campaigns (I'm not sure what this does or how this differs to the 'campaign list') or the template manager which doesn't seem to be useful for anything. Other options seem broken or in need of an overhaul, like the image manager which only allows one image to be uploaded at a time and then won't let you preview it or view the image URL to copy and paste into external HTML docs. Managing dynamic content can be tricky without applying it to an email first, and managing dynamic content rules can be difficult, especially when working in teams of multiple users. I also feel like the Redeye team have the capability to do so much more than the frontend of the platform will allow, but the only way to uncover these services is to ask or wait to be told about them (although the team does tend to be very proactive in communicating with clients!)

Recommendations to others considering RedEye:
The platform really does allow you to work in a way that suits you best. It allows easy access to basic functions for beginners but give you the option to access advanced functions and everything in between! There aren't a lot of bells and whistles initially (there are some that you can request and the Redeye team are always willing to help) but the doors are really open for you to get creative with your campaigns!

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
The segmentation tool within the platform makes it really easy for us to reach out to the right customers without the need for database exports and excel spreadsheets (as we were often relying on before!) As an email designer I find it easy to create segments myself and it has freed up a lot of time within the wider team. The drag and drop interfaces within the segment builder and campaign manager make campaign setup really easy. We have more automation options than ever before, without relying on multiple platforms for different types of email send. Reporting and analysing has also been made much quicker and easier with options and filters which again negate the need for data exports and complicated spreadsheets.

all_reviews.review_title: UI improvements would create a better experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
The segmentation software works effectively enough to allow very detailed parameters to be targeted, and the ability to export directly to Google Ads / Optimize / Socials is also a bonus for easy retargeting within campaigns. Account support is also good.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
Exporting segments could be easier with a 'custom template' that pre-selects certain popular parameters to export, and more integrated data channels that are compatible with each other to allow cross-examination of segmented data within campaigns. The UI could be improved on the email builder, folder system & especially on the dynamic content blocks. Some amends & improvements to the marketing automation package are quite costly and were not documented explicitly in initial contract talks.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having one consolidated view of our customer data allows us to retain & upsell to our existing database via typical workflows such as abandoned baskets, but also allows us to combine online & offline sales history to create a unified targeting strategy for regional & national business.

all_reviews.review_title: Helpful team with a data approach
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
The account management team are happy to help with any queries or help building segments, they also provide valuable insight on a regular basis and have no trouble in keeping in touch with regular meetings. The data feed enables us to use in branch data as well and with older systems in place this is something we are really glad to have. The data held by the platform is vast and there is a lot of potential to unlock. Namely the opportunity for remarketing and the ability to share segments as a cookie to create targeted on site experiences. The mobile responsiveness of emails is great. Use of gifs, videos, timers are all available in email at an additional cost. On hand support with html is also really helpful and generally the platform does what is needed. Deliverability is always positive and never an area for concern. Webinars hosted by Redeye of late have provided some additional learning too. The Redeye design team are also very easy to work with. Designing the look and feel of emails is a positive process and they take ideas and comments and form great emails.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
Platform itself is very clunky, feels old and isn't user friendly / intuitive. Missing mainstream features like drag and drop design, send time optimise, workflow building and reporting is difficult to navigate to those that are not in the platform often. Limited control when it comes to creating anything new. Proofing process is not logical and takes additional time. No where in the platform for lead scoring or to easily show customer scoring, customer lifetime value, frequency of purchasing and customer engagement is not easily accessible. No direct access to their dedicated tech team, hugely reliant on account managers.

Recommendations to others considering RedEye:
How hands on are you wishing to be? The team at Redeye are great to work with and can provide any number of email solutions for you, however with that you are definitely slightly removed from the process and have less control. Ideal for any company that doesn't want to be doing the building or deep dive analysis of email journeys.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
Transferring over transactional emails which will be far improved from the basic site generated ones.
Access to purchasing and browsed data for more relevant targeting.
Central database
Keeping in touch with our customers regularly
Microsite for unsubscribes
Microsite for preferences

all_reviews.review_title: Friendly and helpful staff, good product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
I find it useful that the system generates new segments automatically based on people's behaviour. This will be useful for us going forward. I also like the modular way in which you build emails, dragging and dropping rows in - it makes building multiple emails each week easy.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
Some aspects are a little frustrating. The templates do not autosave as you are editing them and Contour will often time you out if you are on another tab doing something else. This means changes can be lost. Also you are not able to search for an image outside of a particular folder - it would be useful to search for an image you know you have already uploaded to template builder without having to first find the folder.

Recommendations to others considering RedEye:
If you are looking to drive engagement based on customer behaviour and preferences this tool is very useful.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been able to delve deeper into our engagement stats and work out what content is most engaging to our audience. We are also beginning to segment and send people content that is more relevant to them.

all_reviews.review_title: A powerful tool with some usability issues
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
RedEye is an incredibly powerful platform. The segment builder is vast and allows you to target customers in an incredibly precise manner. It also includes a useful built in reporting tool, which captures a range of data so you can analyse anything you need to (subject lines performance, schedule specific or campaign specific performance, send time performance, etc.). The team at RedEye are also really responsive and, when you face an issue, are very fast to resolve problems.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
The UI seems outdated - building segments is not always intuitive, building emails is clunky, etc.

Folder management is near on impossible - you can't delete folders, moving them is glitchy (sometimes you can move folders into a sub folder, other times you can't) and sometimes it won't let you name a folder something, even if the name isn't previously used.

Dynamic content is virtually unusable, as the platform frequently crashes while trying to create dynamic builds.

Sometimes a schedule won't calculate the respondents. If you remove any rules on the schedule, and then re-add them, it calculates them.

The heatmap reporting is quite glitchy - sometimes you just cant see the heatmap, other times, you can, but the "engagement" metrics are shown on different areas of the email than if you look at the engagement on the summary at the bottom of the heatmap.

You cant delete campaigns, or rename them, once you've made them, even if the campaign is empty.

A/B testing is somewhat limited, and you can't do tests such as send time optimisation tests in an intuitive way.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ability to target very specific sets of customers with relevant marketing, and set up automated journeys based on customer behaviour.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic option should be coming off a global ESP
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about RedEye?
Personable with a 'no problem is too big' approach. They cannot solve all of your problems yet they know how to LISTEN. Straight from implementation to live and each month, they continually allow you to deliver your KPIs and mine your database to yield the right message to the right customer.

What do you dislike about RedEye?
If a technical problem occurs, you do not have a central number to call. One of the account managers is the first port of call which IT departments do not love. I.e. a resolution isn't defined quickly. The account manager needs to call somebody else etc...

Recommendations to others considering RedEye:
Seriously consider the value of staying with your existing ESP. If it is just because you've been with them for x years, start looking. RedEye makes the complex simple and helps onboard many users from marketing to customer service.

ESPs make their money within the first year of on boarding you. If you do not double your revenue within a 2 year period with the ESP, you do not have the right account support.

What problems is RedEye solving and how is that benefiting you?
The fact that not all ESPs need to be enterprise, a logic RedEye understands. We are not a massive business yet need more than Mailchimp. Simple and agile ways of scaling marketing automation is what RedEye does with ease.
